intro: Arctotis frutescens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow-orange flowers with a central brownish disc, often surrounded by white or pale pink ray florets. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators make it a valuable addition to ecological and ornamental plantings.
